etymology.description: Pictogram: a footprint pointing downward; cf. 夊 (variant). Shuowen: two legs (𠂊) + trailing stroke (㇏), ‘approach from behind’.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a downward-moving footprint, evoking slow, trailing motion or proceeding from behind. Traditional analyses also read it as two legs with a following stroke, matching the idea of approaching from the rear.

examples.chinese: 这个字的部首是夂(這個字的部首是夂)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège zì de bùshǒu shì zhǐ.
examples.english: The radical of this character is 夂.

examples.chinese: 夂部常表示行走或缓慢前进的意思(夂部常表示行走或緩慢前進的意思)。
examples.pinyin: Zhǐ bù cháng biǎoshì xíngzǒu huò huǎnmàn qiánjìn de yìsi.
examples.english: The 夂 radical often conveys the idea of walking or moving slowly.

examples.chinese: 在字典里，夂和夊要区分清楚(在字典裡，夂和夊要區分清楚)。
examples.pinyin: Zài zìdiǎn lǐ, zhǐ hé suī yào qūfēn qīngchu.
examples.english: In dictionaries, 夂 and 夊 must be clearly distinguished.
